node.title: Sydney Airport board agrees to $23.6bn takeover deal with international consortium
node.alt: A passenger walks next to a departures sign at Sydney International Airport
node.description: Australia's biggest and busiest airport could soon be changing hands, under a $23.6Â billion takeover bid announced to the ASX this morning.
node.content: ["Australia's biggest and busiest airport could soon be changing hands, under a $23.6\u00a0billion takeover bid announced to the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX)\u00a0this morning.", "In a statement, Sydney Airport Limited revealed it had entered into an arrangement with an international consortium, which would acquire 100 per cent of the publicly-listed company.", "The consortium, named Sydney Aviation Alliance, is comprised of several\u00a0Australian and international investment and infrastructure funds.", "Under the plan, Sydney Airport shareholders would receive $8.75 per share.", "The company this morning opened up almost 3 per cent on the ASX, at $8.46, on the back of the announcement.", "The airport's board unanimously recommended that shareholders vote in favour of accepting the offer at meetings likely to be held early next year.", "It came after two earlier proposals had been rejected for $8.25 and $8.45 per share, respectively.", "Among the members of the consortium seeking to take over Sydney Airport include IFM's Australian Infrastructure Fund and Global Infrastructure Fund as well as AustralianSuper, QSuper and Global Infrastructure Partners.", "However, the bid will require regulatory approval.The consortium has been undertaking due diligence on the airport since mid-September, scouring the books and seeking approval from investors.", "A Sydney Airport Alliance spokesperson said the finalisation of the deed was a \"significant step forward\" and the consortium looked forward to security holders voting on the proposed deal.", "\"Our alliance represents many millions of Australians \u2026 we intended to work hard to bring more flights and passengers back to the airport as the aviation industry emerges from COVID-19,\" they said.", "Share prices have fluctuated over the course of the\u00a0pandemic, hitting $5.50 in February this year.", "While Sydney's air patronage had been ravaged during the pandemic, NSW's international border opened last week, and there are plans to reopen all domestic borders, with the exception of WA, before the end of the year.", "\"Today's announcement is the culmination of months of engagement between all parties,\" Sydney Airport chairman David Gonski said.", "\"The Sydney Airport Boards believe the outcome reflects appropriate long-term value for the airport, and unanimously recommend the proposal to security holders, subject to customary conditions such as independent expert approval and no superior proposal.\"", "NSW\u00a0will also have a second international airport, at Badgerys Creek, which is due to open in 2026.", "In 2017 Sydney Airport declined to build the new facility, which is about 50 kilometres\u00a0west of the CBD, citing \"risks\" on monetary returns for their investors as its main reason behind its decision."]
